definition: little sister/girl/(Tw) young female employee working in a low-level role dealing with the public (assistant, waitress, attendant etc)

sentences.english: Not wishing to disturb his baby sister, he tiptoed into the room.
sentences.chinese: 他不想打扰他的小妹妹，蹑手蹑脚地走进了屋里。

sentences.english: A：I took my little sister to see the Thanksgiving Day parade before dinner.
sentences.chinese: 晚饭前我带我的小妹去看了感恩节游行。

sentences.english: My little sister is such a clotheshorse.
sentences.chinese: 我的小妹妹是个特别爱打扮的人。

sentences.english: This time, Liu Yibin and call a few little sister with him.
sentences.chinese: 这次，刘一滨又唤来几个小妹妹陪他。

sentences.english: I am no stranger to the particulars of your youngest sister's infamous elopement.
sentences.chinese: 别以为我不知道你那个小妹妹不要脸私奔的事。

sentences.english: My little sister wrote her homework in the study.
sentences.chinese: 我的小妹妹在书房写作业。

sentences.english: Keep your little sister in. It is too cold outside.
sentences.chinese: 不要让你的小妹妹出去，外面太冷了。

sentences.english: That motherfucker hurt my little sister!
sentences.chinese: 那个大坏蛋伤了我的小妹。

sentences.english: Susan and I were the only children of our families. So the treated me like a kid sister.
sentences.chinese: 苏珊和我都是家中的独女，她带我像一个小妹妹。

sentences.english: My sister and Miss Li Yan were in Yuntai Mountain.
sentences.chinese: 我的小妹和李岩在云台山。

sentences.english: But finally it turned out to be a misunderstanding, Jef only took Carol as his little sister.
sentences.chinese: 结果是一场误会，杰夫只是把她当成小妹妹。

sentences.english: My little sister called the leaves, now just one and a half.
sentences.chinese: 我的小妹妹叫叶子，如今才一岁半。
粉红猪小妹爱她的帆船。

sentences.english: Mother made a beautiful skirt for my little sister.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈给我小妹妹做了一条漂亮的裙子。

sentences.english: My little sister and I were in Renmin Park in Jiaozuo City in the winter of 1983.
sentences.chinese: 1983年冬天，小妹和我在焦作市人民公园留影。

sentences.english: Today, I was driving my little sister to school.
sentences.chinese: 今天我载着小妹妹去学校。

definition: older brother's wife/sister-in-law/(polite address to a younger married woman) sister
big sister/elder sister/older sister (also polite term of address for a girl or woman slightly older than the speaker)
older male cousin via female line
older brother's wife/sister-in-law/elder sister (respectful appellation for an older married woman)
younger female cousin via female line
